thread.title: CHCA, McNicholas reach state golf tournament
thread.title_full: CHCA, McNicholas reach state golf tournament

title: CHCA, McNicholas reach state golf tournament
text:
CHCA, McNicholas reach state golf tournament By Mark Schmetzer, Enquirer contributor 12:48 a.m. EDT October 9, 2015 Buy Photo Connor Hjelm of Madeira tees off from the box. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Sam Gosiger of Summit Country Day tees off for the Silver Knights. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Fullscreen Buy Photo Matt Newman of Indian Hill sends one down the fairway. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Fullscreen Buy Photo Sam Marty of Wyoming hits his second ball from the fairway. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Fullscreen Buy Photo Mitchell McElfresh represented Bethel Tate in the individual round. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Fullscreen Buy Photo Brady Roberts of Cincinnati Christian Schools places his ball on the green. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Cameron Massa of McNick lines up his putt. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Fullscreen Buy Photo Spencer Folan of Cincinnati Country Day leads off his group from the tee box. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo John Lesinger of Middletown Christian takes a moment to line up his putt. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Max Lane of Seven Hills chips onto the green. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. Brandon Severn for the Enquirer Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide Buy Photo Spencer Folan of Cincinnati Country Day leads off his group from the tee box. The Division 2 and 3 boys Southwest District golf tournament was held at Weatherwax golf course on Thursday, October 8th, 2015. (Photo: Brandon Severn for the Enquirer) Buy Photo 
MIDDDLETOWN – If timing is an art, then the Cincinnati Hills Christian Academy boys' golf team was Da Vinci on Thursday. 
The Eagles picked the most crucial day of the year to turn in their best team effort, and that combined with an increase in the number of qualifying teams out of the Division II district tournament led to a berth in next week's state tournament. 
Senior Connor Olson shot a 39-39 – 78 at Middletown's Weatherwax Golf Course to lead CHCA to the school's second berth in the state tournament and first since 2003, according to the Ohio High School Athletic Association website. 
"This is the first time all year all five guys played close to their ability," second-year coach Mark Kudnar said. "It was great timing on their part." 
The Southwest District sent three Division II teams and three individuals not on qualifying teams to the state tournament for the first time in at least 20 years, long-time tournament director Tim Tilton said. That opened up a slot for CHCA. 
"I'll take luck every day of the week," Kudnar said. 
Junior Ty DeBonis earned medalist honors with a 38-33 – 77 to lead McNicholas to its second consecutive district championship. 
"That was something," DeBonis said, crediting an adjustment in his putting halfway through the round for his blazing finish. "That gave me a little more confidence. It really helped." 
Rockets coach Justin Lenczicki was impressed that DeBonis shot 3-under par on the back nine. 
"That's a testament to how hard he works," Lenczicki said. "Anybody on the team will tell he's our hardest worker." 
McNicholas edged Dayton Oakwood by two strokes. 
"That was fun," Lenczicki said. "It was a little stressful. We've been on a roll the last three weeks." 
Fenwick junior Miles Jena, who qualified as an individual last season, shot a 38-35 – 73 to lead Division II individual qualifiers. Madeira sophomore Ethan Snyder, who's in his first season on the Mustangs team, overcame a 4-over par eight on his 14th hole to finish with a 35-41 – 76 and earn an individual berth. 
"After that eight, I knew I had par out," Snyder said. "I tried to clear everything out of my mind." 
Seven Hills junior Jack Lane earned the second Division III individual qualifying berth in a three-hole playoff. 
Two Division III teams and two individuals not on qualifying teams reached the state tournament. 
The state tournaments are scheduled for next Friday and Saturday. The Division II boys' tournament will be played on the North Star course in Sunbury while the Division III tournament is set for Ohio State University's Scarlet Course. 
The Division II girls' tournament is scheduled to be played on OSU's Gray Course. Monroe junior Sammi Blackburn shot a 71 to qualfify for an indidivual berth in the state tournament and earn medalist honors in the district tournament on Wednesday at Pipestone Golf Course in Miamisburg. Seven Hills senior Alyssa Akiyama also qualified and finished second with a 73. 
The Division I boys and girls district tournaments are scheduled to be played next Thursday at Weatherwax. Lakota East, Milford, defending state champion Moeller and Mason qualified on Tuesday out of the Glenview boys' sectional, while defending district champion St. Xavier, Elder, La Salle and Hamilton earned berths out of the Miami Whitewater sectional on Wednesday. 
Girls' teams moving on include Mason, St. Ursula and Mercy from the Walden Ponds sectional and Ursuline, Sycamore, Lakota West and Oak Hills out of the Hamilton Elks sectional. Read or Share this story: http://cin.ci/1Ll7ar8 TOP VIDEOS
